snippet: The overall increase was 9 percent over the last decade, and two-thirds of that rise came from two Orthodox Jewish neighborhoods in Brooklyn that have high birthrates.
abstract: Jewish Community Study of New York: 2011 shows that the Jewish population in the New York area grew by 9 percent over the last decade, reversing a longstanding trend of decline.
lead_paragraph: The overall increase was 9 percent over the last decade, and two-thirds of that rise came from two Orthodox Jewish neighborhoods in Brooklyn that have high birthrates.

headline.seo: Reversing Past Trend, New York’s Jewish Population Rises
headline.main: Jewish Population Is Up in the New York Region
headline.print_headline: Jewish Population Is Up In the New York Region
